summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell on charges of conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, and for perjury in a 2016 deposition. It details the allegations of grooming and abuse spanning from 1994 to 1997 across multiple locations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with enticing and transporting minors for illegal sexual activity, conspiracy, and perjury for her alleged role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier alleged to have sexually abused minor girls with the assistance of Ghislaine Maxwell from at least 1994 to 1997.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the press release and made a statement detailing Maxwell's alleged crimes and role in Epstein's abuse scheme.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Made a statement commending the victims for their bravery and condemning Maxwell and Epstein's actions.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Made a statement condemning the alleged crimes and commending investigators.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Assigned to preside over Ghislaine Maxwell's case.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls from at least 1994 to 1997.
Maxwell is alleged to have facilitated, aided, and participated in Epstein's sexual abuse of minors, and in some cases participated in the abuse herself.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested in the morning and charged in a federal indictment unsealed in Manhattan.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse Conspiracy
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein allegedly conspired to sexually abuse minor girls as young as 14, grooming them and transporting them across state lines.

events.title: Maxwell's Deposition and Perjury
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell testified under oath in a civil proceeding and is charged with making repeated false statements about specific acts and events related to the abuse.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged with conspiracy to entice and transport minors for illegal sexual activity, and with perjury.
The indictment alleges Maxwell played a critical role in grooming minor victims for Jeffrey Epstein from at least 1994 to 1997, with victims as young as 14.
Abuse allegedly occurred at Epstein's residences in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, as well as Maxwell's residence in London.
Maxwell is charged with making false statements under oath during a 2016 civil deposition.
The case is assigned to U.S. District Judge Alison J. Nathan and is being prosecuted by the Public Corruption Unit of the U.S. Attorney's Office.
